text: Which of the following statements is true?

answers.text: The default time zone of all VM Instances regardless of region is UTC
The default time zone of all VM Instances regardless of region is CST
The default time zone of your VM instances match that of the region it is running in

text: Which of the following does Compute Engine do when you specify a Linux VM startup script?

answers.text: Copies the startup script to the VM
Sets run permissions on the startup script
Runs the startup script with the command sudo <script name>
Runs the startup script as the root user when the VM boots

text: Which of the following Metadata keys hold the location of a Linux VM startup script?

answers.text: startup-script-local
startup-script
startup-script-url

text: Which are the following methods are valid ways to pass a startup script to a Linux VM instance?

answers.text: Inline via the Advanced Options Automation
Pulled directly from GCP NFS Service
Passed in as a local file
Pulled in from a cloud storage bucket

text: A linux VM startup script can only be run at first boot, true or false?

answers.text: TRUE
FALSE

text: Which of the following does Compute Engine do when you specify a Windows VM startup script?

answers.text: Copies the startup script to the VM
Begins running when the PowerShell Service starts
Administrator user runs the script during startup
Task Scheduler runs the startup script as the LocalSystem account when the VM boots
